theoryText: Based on Robin's extreme fear upon seeing Aokiji and his comment about her growing into a beautiful woman, fans theorize that Aokiji was present during the Ohara incident when Robin was a child. The theory suggests that despite being a Marine, Aokiji may have shown mercy to young Robin, allowing her to escape the Buster Call that destroyed Ohara. This would explain why Robin recognizes him and fears him, yet he doesn't immediately arrest her.
evidence: Robin's unprecedented terror upon seeing Aokiji
Aokiji recognizes Robin and comments on her growth since childhood
Aokiji's personality seems too laid-back to commit genocide
Future revelations about the Ohara incident

theoryText: Fans theorize that Aokiji's sleeping in the jungle and generally laid-back demeanor represents a unique philosophy of justice within the Marines - 'Lazy Justice.' This contrasts with other Admirals' more aggressive approaches. The theory suggests that Aokiji doesn't blindly follow orders and instead follows his own moral compass, which may explain why he doesn't immediately attack the Straw Hats despite Robin being a wanted criminal.
evidence: Aokiji found sleeping in the jungle with no apparent mission
His casual attitude toward encountering pirates
Bicycle as transportation shows unconventional nature
Doesn't immediately arrest Robin despite her wanted status

theoryTitle: The Three Admirals Represent Different Elements
theoryText: With Aokiji's introduction as the Ice Admiral, fans theorize that the three Marine Admirals represent different elemental forces in a rock-paper-scissors relationship. Aokiji (Ice) would be countered by the Fire/Magma Admiral, creating a natural power balance among the Navy's strongest fighters. This theory was based on the nature-based Logia fruits shown.
evidence: Aokiji possesses the Ice-Ice Fruit (Hie Hie no Mi)
Robin mentions there are three Admirals total
Logia fruits often have elemental themes
Traditional Japanese element theory

theoryTitle: Robin's Bounty Connected to Ohara Knowledge
theoryText: The fact that an Admiral specifically recognizes Robin and knows about her past suggests that Robin's bounty and wanted status are not just for being a pirate, but because she possesses dangerous knowledge from Ohara about the Void Century and ancient weapons. Aokiji's presence and recognition of her hints at a larger conspiracy involving the World Government's fear of this knowledge.
evidence: Aokiji personally knows Robin from childhood
Robin's extreme fear suggests traumatic past
Robin is an archaeologist from Ohara
Aokiji's comment implies he was at Ohara

theoryTitle: Foxy's Return Arc Was Extended for Pacing
theoryText: Fans theorize that the Foxy's Return arc (episodes 225-228) was created as anime-original filler to prevent the anime from catching up to the manga. This would explain why Foxy returns immediately after being defeated in the Davy Back Fight, and why the arc has lower ratings compared to canon content. The theory suggests the anime needed buffer episodes before the critical Water 7 arc.
evidence: Foxy's Return arc is not in the manga
Lower IMDb rating (6.5/10) compared to series average
Positioned right before the major Water 7 arc
Anime was catching up to manga around this time
